marklogic.body:
I am a licensed clinical social worker, but not fully versed in eating disorders. However, a lot of the research that I'm doing around food lately tells me that processed food w/ MSG, sugar of any kind, (fructose is included), and grains often trigger food cravings, binges, and increase the risk of depression/Anxiety immensely. There's been some talk that how your gut absorbs food directly impacts your neurotransmitters---mind-body link. I'm currently craving sugar like a madwoman, but I know it's roughly equivalent to cocaine in its effects. No sugar/wheat/corn for me! Just gotta get past the cravings first. ;)
PLEASE don't go raw vegan for very long--we need fats to absorb fat soluble vitamins, and many nutrients are better absorbed cooked. Also, the NIH/Pubmed has shown pernicious Vitamin B12 deficiencies even after years of no longer being vegan.
Some books that got me very interested in eating for nutrition instead of calories/macronutrients: Deep Nutrition & Food Rules by Dr. Cate Shanahan (family medicine), Wheat Belly by Dr. William Davis (cardiologist), and the UltraMind Solution by Dr. Mark Hyman---he comes Off a little quackier than the others.
If you can, ask your doctor to test your micronutrient levels (Spectracell makes a test) and work with them & a nutritionist to get balanced out. As a nation, we're overfed, undernourished, and putting a bunch of weird chemicals in our bodies that throw our hormones, brains, and weight out of control.
